logTitle: IELTS Reading Log: The steam car

lexicalItems.sourceContext: When primitive automobiles first began to appear in the 1800s, their engines were based on steam power.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Relating to the earliest stage of the development of cars; simple and not technologically advanced.

phase3Production.content: Museums often display primitive automobiles to show how far car technology has advanced.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...their engines were based on steam power.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Dựa trên năng lượng hơi nước

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Using the force produced when water is heated to a vapor as the primary source of energy.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dựa trên năng lượng hơi nước

phase3Production.content: The first locomotives were based on steam power, revolutionizing rail transport.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: enjoyed a long and successful career
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Steam had already enjoyed a long and successful career in the railways, so it was only natural that the technology evolved into a miniaturized version...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có một sự nghiệp lâu dài và thành công

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have been used effectively and prosperously for an extended period.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có một quá trình phát triển lâu dài và thành công
relatedCollocates: was widely used for a long time

phase3Production.content: The actor enjoyed a long and successful career, starring in over fifty films.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it was only natural that the technology evolved into a miniaturized version which was separate from the trains.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A smaller-scale model or form of something.

phase3Production.content: Early mobile phones were huge, but technology allowed for the creation of a miniaturized version we use today.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But these early cars inherited steam’s weaknesses along with its strengths.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Thừa hưởng những điểm yếu của hơi nước

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have received the same disadvantages or flaws from a predecessor.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thừa hưởng những điểm yếu của hơi nước

phase3Production.content: The new government inherited the previous administration's economic weaknesses.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The boilers had to be lit by hand, and they required about twenty minutes to build up pressure before they could be driven.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be ignited manually, without an automatic system.

phase3Production.content: Before the invention of electric ignition, old gas lamps had to be lit by hand every evening.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...they required about twenty minutes to build up pressure before they could be driven.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To gradually increase the force produced by a gas or liquid in a confined space.

phase3Production.content: A pressure cooker works by allowing steam to build up inside, which cooks food faster.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Furthermore, their water reservoirs only lasted for about thirty miles before needing replenishment.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Requiring a refill or the restoration of a stock or supply of something.

phase3Production.content: After a long hike, my water bottle was empty and in desperate need of replenishment.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Despite such shortcomings, these newly designed self-propelled carriages offered quick transportation...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Vehicles that are able to move by their own power, without being pulled by horses or other external forces.

phase3Production.content: The invention of the self-propelled carriage marked the beginning of the automotive era.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and by the early 1900s it was not uncommon to see such machines shuttling wealthy citizens around town.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Chuyên chở những công dân giàu có

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Transporting rich people from one place to another, often as a regular service.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chuyên chở những công dân giàu có

phase3Production.content: The luxury hotel provides a limousine service for shuttling wealthy guests to and from the airport.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But the glory days of steam cars were numbered.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những ngày huy hoàng... đã được đếm

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An idiom meaning that the period of greatest success or prosperity for something was coming to an end.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những ngày huy hoàng... sắp tàn

phase3Production.content: Once the new technology was introduced, the glory days of the old system were numbered.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: A new technology called the Internal Combustion Engine soon appeared, which offered the ability to drive down the road just moments after starting.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An engine that generates motive power by the burning of gasoline, oil, or other fuel with air inside the engine, the hot gases produced being used to drive a piston or do other work.

phase3Production.content: Most modern cars are powered by an Internal Combustion Engine.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: At first, these noisy gasoline cars were unpopular because they were more complicated to operate and they had difficult hand-crank starters...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bộ khởi động bằng tay quay

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A manual device with a handle that had to be turned by hand to start an engine.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bộ khởi động bằng tay quay

phase3Production.content: Early cars were notoriously difficult to start, often requiring great strength to turn the hand-crank starters.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...which were known to break arms when the engines backfired.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: (Of an engine) to undergo a mistimed explosion in the cylinder or exhaust.

phase3Production.content: The old car made a loud noise as its engine backfired.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But in 1912 General Motors introduced the electric starter, and over the following few years steam power was gradually phased out.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be slowly and systematically withdrawn or discontinued.

phase3Production.content: Incandescent light bulbs are being gradually phased out in favor of more energy-efficient LEDs.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Even as the market was declining, four brothers made one last effort to rekindle the technology.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To revive or bring back a technology that has fallen out of use or favor.

phase3Production.content: There is a growing movement to rekindle the technology of traditional crafts.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: It comprised parts taken from a wrecked early steam car but reconfigured to drive an engine of their own design.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bao gồm các bộ phận lấy từ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be made up of components that were sourced from something else.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bao gồm các bộ phận lấy từ

phase3Production.content: The sculpture comprised parts taken from old machinery and scrap metal.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...but reconfigured to drive an engine of their own design.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được tái cấu trúc để vận hành

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be rearranged or altered in shape or structure in order to power something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được tái cấu trúc để vận hành

phase3Production.content: The old laptop was reconfigured to drive a new home automation system.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Though it did not run well, the Doble brothers went on to build a second and third prototype in the following years.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A first or preliminary version of a device or vehicle from which other forms are developed.

phase3Production.content: The company is testing a new prototype for its next-generation electric car.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Though the Doble boys’ third prototype, nicknamed the Model B, still lacked the convenience of an internal combustion engine, it drew the attention of automobile trade magazines...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Thu hút sự chú ý của

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To attract the interest or notice of someone or something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thu hút sự chú ý của

phase3Production.content: The young artist's unusual style quickly drew the attention of the art world.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The Model B proved to be superior to gasoline automobiles in many ways.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Chứng tỏ là vượt trội hơn

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be shown through experience or testing to be better than something else.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chứng tỏ là vượt trội hơn
relatedCollocates: was shown to be better than

phase3Production.content: The new material proved to be superior to traditional plastic in both strength and flexibility.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Its high-pressure steam drove the engine pistons in virtual silence, in contrast to clattering gas engines...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: As an opposition or difference to something else.

phase3Production.content: In contrast to her outgoing sister, she was very shy and reserved.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...in contrast to clattering gas engines which emitted the aroma of burned hydrocarbons.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Động cơ xăng kêu lách cách

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Gasoline engines that make a loud, rattling sound.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Động cơ xăng kêu lách cách

phase3Production.content: The old truck's clattering gas engine could be heard from a block away.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...which emitted the aroma of burned hydrocarbons.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Organic compounds consisting entirely of hydrogen and carbon that have been combusted, often producing a distinct smell.

phase3Production.content: The smell of burned hydrocarbons is a common sign of an inefficient engine.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Its high-pressure steam drove the engine pistons in virtual silence...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Trong sự im lặng gần như tuyệt đối

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: In a state of almost complete quiet.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trong sự im lặng gần như tuyệt đối

phase3Production.content: The electric car moved through the streets in virtual silence.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Perhaps most impressively, the Model B was amazingly swift. It could accelerate from zero to sixty miles per hour in just fifteen seconds, a feat described as ‘remarkable acceleration’ by Automobile magazine in 1914.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Khả năng tăng tốc đáng nể

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An unusually impressive capacity to increase speed quickly.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khả năng tăng tốc đáng nể

phase3Production.content: Modern electric sports cars are known for their remarkable acceleration.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The following year Abner Doble drove the Model B from Massachusetts to Detroit in order to seek investment in his automobile design...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To try to find people or organizations who will put money into a business or project in order to make a profit.

phase3Production.content: The startup is currently trying to seek investment to expand its operations.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: He and his brothers immediately began working on the Model C, which was intended to expand upon the innovations of the Model B.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Mở rộng dựa trên những đổi mới

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To further develop or add to the new ideas or methods that have already been introduced.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Mở rộng dựa trên những đổi mới

phase3Production.content: The new software will expand upon the innovations of its predecessor with more advanced features.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The brothers added features such as a key-based ignition in the cabin, eliminating the need for the operator to manually ignite the boiler.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Hệ thống khởi động bằng chìa khóa

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A system for starting an engine by turning a key.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hệ thống khởi động bằng chìa khóa

phase3Production.content: The introduction of the key-based ignition was a major step forward in automotive convenience.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...eliminating the need for the operator to manually ignite the boiler.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Loại bỏ sự cần thiết của

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To completely remove the requirement for something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Loại bỏ sự cần thiết của

phase3Production.content: Automatic transmissions were created, eliminating the need for drivers to use a clutch pedal.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...eliminating the need for the operator to manually ignite the boiler.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To light the boiler by hand.

phase3Production.content: In the old steamship, a crew member had to manually ignite the boiler hours before departure.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with much greater speed, much simpler driving controls, and a virtually silent powerplant.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Hệ thống động lực gần như im lặng

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An engine and transmission system that operates with almost no noise.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hệ thống động lực gần như im lặng

phase3Production.content: Electric vehicles are known for their smooth ride and virtually silent powerplant.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: By the following April, the General Engineering Company had received 5,390 deposits for Doble Detroits...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nhận được... tiền đặt cọc cho

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have been given a sum of money payable as a first installment on the purchase of something or as a pledge for a contract, the balance being payable later.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nhận được... tiền đặt cọc cho

phase3Production.content: The developer received hundreds of deposits for the new apartments before construction even began.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Later that year Abner Doble delivered unhappy news to those eagerly awaiting the delivery of their modern new cars.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be waiting for something with great excitement and impatience.

phase3Production.content: Fans were eagerly awaiting the release of the final book in the series.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Those buyers who received the handful of completed cars complained that the vehicles were sluggish and erratic, sometimes going in reverse when they should go forward.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Slow-moving or inactive, and not even or regular in pattern or movement; unpredictable.

phase3Production.content: My old computer has become sluggish and erratic, often freezing for no reason.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The new engine design, though innovative, was still plagued with serious glitches.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bị ám ảnh bởi những trục trặc nghiêm trọng

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be continually troubled or distressed by significant, unexpected, and typically minor faults in a system or machine.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bị cản trở bởi những trục trặc nghiêm trọng

phase3Production.content: The launch of the new video game was plagued with serious glitches that made it unplayable for many.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The brothers made one final attempt to produce a viable steam automobile.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một chiếc ô tô hơi nước khả thi

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A steam-powered car that is capable of working successfully; feasible.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một chiếc ô tô hơi nước khả thi

phase3Production.content: The company is searching for a viable alternative to plastic packaging.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: In early 1924, the Doble brothers shipped a Model E to New York City to be road-tested by the Automobile Club of America.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được chạy thử nghiệm trên đường

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be tested on the road in real driving conditions.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được chạy thử nghiệm trên đường

phase3Production.content: The new model of the car will be road-tested extensively before it goes on sale.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: After sitting overnight in freezing temperatures, the car was pushed out into the road and left to sit for over an hour in the frosty morning air.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Temperatures at or below the freezing point of water (0°C or 32°F).

phase3Production.content: You should protect your plants from the freezing temperatures expected tonight.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: at the turn of the key
lexicalItems.sourceContext: At the turn of the key, the boiler lit and reached its operating pressure inside of forty seconds.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The action of rotating a key in a lock or ignition.

phase3Production.content: The engine started immediately at the turn of the key.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the boiler lit and reached its operating pressure inside of forty seconds.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The specific level of pressure at which a machine or system is designed to function.

phase3Production.content: The steam engine cannot run until the boiler reaches its correct operating pressure.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: As they drove the test vehicle further, they found that its evenly distributed weight lent it surprisingly good handling, even though it was so heavy.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Trọng lượng được phân bổ đều

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Mass that is spread out in a balanced and uniform way.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trọng lượng được phân bổ đều

phase3Production.content: The car's evenly distributed weight gives it excellent stability in corners.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...lent it surprisingly good handling, even though it was so heavy.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The quality of being easy to control and maneuver while driving.

phase3Production.content: Sports cars are prized for their powerful engines and responsive, good handling.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and it achieved about fifteen miles per gallon of kerosene with negligible emissions.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Lượng khí thải không đáng kể

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An amount of discharged pollutants that is so small or unimportant as to be not worth considering.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Lượng khí thải không đáng kể

phase3Production.content: Modern electric cars produce negligible emissions compared to gasoline vehicles.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Sadly, the Dobles’ brilliant steam car never was a financial success.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Thành công về mặt tài chính

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The achievement of wealth and profitability.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thành công về mặt tài chính

phase3Production.content: Although the movie received critical acclaim, it was not a major financial success.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...because Abner Doble tinkered endlessly with the design.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Mày mò không ngừng với thiết kế

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have made small changes to the design continuously and without stopping, in an attempt to improve or repair it.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Mày mò không ngừng với thiết kế

phase3Production.content: The inventor tinkered endlessly with his creation, always looking for ways to make it better.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: By the time the company folded in 1931, fewer than fifty of the amazing Model E steam cars had been produced.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: (Of a business) to close down because it cannot make enough money to continue.

phase3Production.content: Due to the economic downturn, the company folded after just two years of operation.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: For his whole career, until his death in 1961, Abner Doble remained adamant that steam-powered automobiles were at least equal to gasoline cars, if not superior.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have continued to be very certain and determined in one's belief or opinion about something.

phase3Production.content: Despite the criticism, the scientist remained adamant that his theory was correct.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...steam-powered automobiles were at least equal to gasoline cars, if not superior.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Ít nhất là ngang bằng với

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be as good as, but not less than, something else.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ít nhất là ngang bằng với

phase3Production.content: In terms of performance, the new model is at least equal to its main competitor.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...steam-powered automobiles were at least equal to gasoline cars, if not superior.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nếu không muốn nói là vượt trội hơn

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Used to suggest that something may be even better or greater than what was just said.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nếu không muốn nói là vượt trội hơn

phase3Production.content: His performance in the final was excellent, if not superior, to all others.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Many of the Model E Dobles which have survived are still in good working condition...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Trong tình trạng hoạt động tốt

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Functioning properly and well-maintained.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trong tình trạng hoạt động tốt

phase3Production.content: He bought a vintage radio from the 1950s that is still in good working condition.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...some having been driven over half a million miles with only normal maintenance.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The routine process of keeping something in good condition.

phase3Production.content: With only normal maintenance, this type of car can last for over 200,000 miles.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Astonishingly, an unmodified Doble Model E runs clean enough to pass the emissions laws in California today...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Not changed or altered from its original form.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Không bị sửa đổi, nguyên bản

phase3Production.content: The car used in the race was completely stock and unmodified.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...runs clean enough to pass the emissions laws in California today...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To meet the legal standards for the amount of pollutants a vehicle is allowed to release.

phase3Production.content: Older cars often have difficulty trying to pass the strict new emissions laws.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: It is true that the technology poses some difficult problems, but you cannot help but wonder how efficient a steam car might be with the benefit of modern materials and computers.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Gây ra một số vấn đề khó khăn

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To present or create some challenging issues.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Gây ra một số vấn đề khó khăn

phase3Production.content: The plan to build a new airport poses some difficult problems for the local environment.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...but you cannot help but wonder how efficient a steam car might be with the benefit of modern materials and computers.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be unable to stop yourself from thinking about something or asking yourself a question about it.

phase3Production.content: Looking at the ancient pyramids, you cannot help but wonder how they were built.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...how efficient a steam car might be with the benefit of modern materials and computers.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: With the advantage provided by something.

phase3Production.content: With the benefit of hindsight, I realize I should have made a different decision.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Under the current pressure to improve automotive performance and reduce emissions, it is not unthinkable that the steam car may rise again.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Dưới áp lực hiện tại để

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Subject to the present-day demands or urgent need to do something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dưới áp lực hiện tại để

phase3Production.content: Many companies are under the current pressure to become more environmentally friendly.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to improve automotive performance and reduce emissions...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The capabilities of a motor vehicle, especially its speed, acceleration, and handling.

phase3Production.content: Engineers are constantly working to improve automotive performance while also increasing fuel efficiency.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it is not unthinkable that the steam car may rise again.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Không phải là không thể tưởng tượng được rằng

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: It is possible to imagine or believe that something could happen.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Không phải là không thể tưởng tượng được rằng

phase3Production.content: With the rapid advancement of technology, it is not unthinkable that we will have flying cars in the future.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it is not unthinkable that the steam car may rise again.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có thể trỗi dậy trở lại

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Might become popular or prominent once more.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có thể trỗi dậy trở lại

phase3Production.content: After years of being out of fashion, vinyl records may rise again in popularity.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Despite such shortcomings, these newly designed self-propelled carriages offered quick transportation...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Faults or failures to meet a certain standard.

phase3Production.content: Despite a few shortcomings, the new software is a major improvement over the old version.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Even as the market was declining, four brothers made one last effort to rekindle the technology.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A final attempt to do something.

phase3Production.content: The team made one last effort to score a goal in the final seconds of the game.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it drew the attention of automobile trade magazines due to its numerous improvements over previous steam cars.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các tạp chí thương mại ô tô

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Periodicals containing articles and information of interest to people in the car industry.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các tạp chí thương mại ô tô

phase3Production.content: The new engine design was featured in several major automobile trade magazines.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...due to its numerous improvements over previous steam cars.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Many enhancements or advancements.

phase3Production.content: The latest version of the software includes numerous improvements to performance and security.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Its high-pressure steam drove the engine pistons in virtual silence...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Steam that is kept at a pressure significantly higher than atmospheric pressure.

phase3Production.content: Industrial turbines are often powered by high-pressure steam.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Its high-pressure steam drove the engine pistons in virtual silence...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The cylindrical components that move up and down inside the cylinders of an engine.

phase3Production.content: The force of the explosion pushes the engine pistons downwards, turning the crankshaft.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Perhaps most impressively, the Model B was amazingly swift.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nhanh một cách đáng kinh ngạc

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Surprisingly quick or fast.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nhanh một cách đáng kinh ngạc

phase3Production.content: The cheetah is an amazingly swift runner, capable of reaching speeds of over 70 miles per hour.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with much greater speed, much simpler driving controls, and a virtually silent powerplant.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bộ điều khiển lái đơn giản hơn

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The mechanisms for operating a vehicle that are less complicated and easier to use.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bộ điều khiển lái đơn giản hơn

phase3Production.content: Modern cars have much simpler driving controls than their early counterparts.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Those buyers who received the handful of completed cars complained...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A small number or amount of people or things.

phase3Production.content: Only a handful of people attended the meeting due to the bad weather.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The brothers made one final attempt to produce a viable steam automobile.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A last try to achieve something.

phase3Production.content: He made one final attempt to convince his boss, but his proposal was rejected.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and left to sit for over an hour in the frosty morning air.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Không khí buổi sáng băng giá

phase2Annotation.translationVI: Không khí buổi sáng băng giá

phase3Production.content: I could see my breath in the frosty morning air.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: As they drove the test vehicle further, they found that its evenly distributed weight lent it surprisingly good handling...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A vehicle used for evaluation and testing purposes, often a prototype.

phase3Production.content: The car company put the new test vehicle through thousands of miles of rigorous trials.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: As the new Doble steamer was further developed and tested, its maximum speed was pushed to over a hundred miles per hour...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được phát triển và thử nghiệm thêm

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be improved and evaluated more.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được phát triển và thử nghiệm thêm

phase3Production.content: As the recipe was further developed and tested, the flavor of the dish improved significantly.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and it achieved about fifteen miles per gallon of kerosene with negligible emissions.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Dặm trên mỗi gallon dầu hỏa

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A measure of fuel efficiency for a vehicle using kerosene as fuel.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dặm trên mỗi gallon dầu hỏa

phase3Production.content: The old heater was inefficient, consuming many miles per gallon of kerosene.
